unnormalised: Okay, so, Indian Airways... let’s talk about flying high (sometimes literally!) with our very own desi airlines, eh? I’ve traveled quite a bit within India, and boy, do I have stories. From the organized chaos at check-in to the questionable "vegetarian" meals, it's always an adventure. This is my take on some of the experiences one might encounter.
normalised: Okay, so, Indian Airways, let’s talk about flying high, sometimes literally, with our very own desi airlines, eh? I have traveled quite a bit within India, and boy, do I have stories. From the organized chaos at check-in to the questionable "vegetarian" meals, it is always an adventure. This is my take on some of the experiences one might encounter.

unnormalised: First things first, booking tickets. Now, I usually check sites like MakeMyTrip or Yatra.com, you know, for those "deals". I recently booked a flight from Delhi to Bangalore for 15/08/2024 on Indigo, cost me Rs. 6500. Not bad, considering it was a long weekend. Pro tip: book in advance, guys. Prices skyrocket closer to the date, especially during Diwali or Holi.
normalised: First things first, booking tickets. Now, I usually check sites like MakeMyTrip or Yatra dot com, you know, for those "deals". I recently booked a flight from Delhi to Bangalore for fifteenth august two thousand and twenty four on Indigo, cost me rupee six thousand five hundred. Not bad, considering it was a long weekend. Pro tip: book in advance, guys. Prices skyrocket closer to the date, especially during Diwali or Holi.

unnormalised: Speaking of Indigo, they’re generally on time, which is a BIG plus in my book. But, let’s be real, sometimes flights get delayed. Once, I was stuck at Mumbai airport for 3 hours because of "operational reasons." They gave us a measly sandwich and a bottle of water. Seriously, Air India gave us a whole meal once, with dessert even, when our flight was delayed 2hrs.
normalised: Speaking of Indigo, they are generally on time, which is a big plus in my book. But, let’s be real, sometimes flights get delayed. Once, I was stuck at Mumbai airport for three hours because of "operational reasons." They gave us a measly sandwich and a bottle of water. Seriously, Air India gave us a whole meal once, with dessert even, when our flight was delayed two hours.

unnormalised: And then there's the food. Oh, the food! It’s either "veg" or "non-veg," and sometimes, you’re not entirely sure what you’re getting. I once ordered a vegetarian meal on SpiceJet and got a paneer dish that tasted suspiciously like chicken. I'm a vegetarian, mind you! I swear, someone's playing pranks in the airline kitchen. That being said, sometimes you get a real treat and the food is yum. Just don't be surprised if you end up with more carbs than necessary.

That being said, sometimes you get a real treat and the food is yum. Just don't be surprised if you end up with more carbs than necessary.

unnormalised: Then we have the baggage allowance. 15 kg check-in baggage and 7 kg hand baggage, right? But who actually weighs their bag? I always end up stuffing everything I own into my carry-on to avoid excess baggage fees. My last trip I tried to bring on a 20kg bag, thinking no one would notice. They noticed. And I had to pay. Rs 2000. Ouch.

I always end up stuffing everything I own into my carry-on to avoid excess baggage fees. My last trip I tried to bring on a twenty kilogram bag, thinking no one would notice. They noticed. And I had to pay. Rupee two thousand. Ouch.

unnormalised: Don't get me started on the onboard entertainment. Half the time, the screens don't work, or they're showing some ancient Bollywood movie I've already seen a million times. I always download a few movies on my phone before I fly. And a good set of headphones are a must-have for any Indian flight.

I always download a few movies on my phone before I fly. And a good set of headphones are a must-have for any Indian flight.

unnormalised: The cabin crew are usually pretty good, though. Always smiling, even when dealing with the most annoying passengers (and trust me, there are plenty). Shout out to the amazing air hostesses who manage to keep their cool despite everything. One gave me an extra blanket once, because the AC was blasting. Saved me from freezing!
normalised: The cabin crew are usually pretty good, though. Always smiling, even when dealing with the most annoying passengers, and trust me, there are plenty. Shout out to the amazing air hostesses who manage to keep their cool despite everything. One gave me an extra blanket once, because the A-C was blasting. Saved me from freezing!

unnormalised: And let’s not forget the announcements. "Ladies and gentlemen, welcome aboard flight AI 101 to New York..." or is it? It’s so hard to understand them sometimes! I swear, half the time they're mumbling into the microphone. I always feel like I'm missing some vital information.

unnormalised: But hey, despite all the chaos and occasional inconveniences, flying within India is an experience in itself. It's a glimpse into our diverse culture, a testament to our resilience, and a whole lot of fun (sometimes, unintentionally so). I always meet interesting people on flights.
normalised: But hey, despite all the chaos and occasional inconveniences, flying within India is an experience in itself. It is a glimpse into our diverse culture, a testament to our resilience, and a whole lot of fun, sometimes, unintentionally so. I always meet interesting people on flights.

unnormalised: So, next time you’re booking a flight on an Indian airline, remember to pack your patience, your sense of humor, and maybe a snack or two. And don't forget to keep an eye out for those "sale" fares! Happy flying, folks!
